medical_history.chief_complaint: Rectal bleeding, decreased appetite, weight loss, and decreased calibre of stool.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in June 2007; they included rectal bleeding and altered bowel habits. The severity of symptoms progressed, leading to significant concern for colorectal cancer.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Colonoscopy in May 2006 showed no abnormalities.
medical_history.family_history: Significant for reported, but unconfirmed, early-onset colon cancer in three male and female first-degree and second-degree relatives.
